Article.ArticleTitle: Decomposition of refractory aniline aerofloat collector in aqueous solution by an ozone/vacuum-UV (O<sub>3</sub>/VUV) process.

AbstractText: The degradation of refractory aniline aerofloat (AAF) collector was investigated by an ozone/Vacuum-UV (O<sub>3</sub>/VUV) process. The effects of O<sub>3</sub> dosage and initial pH on the AAF degradation were studied. The total organic carbon (TOC) and concentrations of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow> <msubsup><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow> <mn>4</mn> <mrow><mn>2</mn> <mo>-</mo></mrow> </msubsup> </math> , <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow> <msubsup><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow> <mn>4</mn> <mrow><mn>3</mn> <mo>-</mo></mrow> </msubsup> </math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow> <msubsup><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mo>-</mo></msubsup> </math> anions were measured to evaluate the AAF mineralization. The solid phase extraction and gas chromatography-mass spectrometry (SPE/GC-MS) was developed to identify byproducts. The results showed that 99.84% of AAF could be removed by the O<sub>3</sub>/VUV, and the AAF degradation was enhanced at higher O<sub>3</sub> dosage and initial solution pH. The radical scavenging tests revealed that most of AAF was degraded by OH• radicals, and the O<sub>3</sub>/UV<sub>254nm</sub> made the main contribution in AAF degradation in the O<sub>3</sub>/VUV system. The mineralization extents of C, S, P and N elements of AAF at 180 min reached 47.74%, 93.94%, 17.71% and 45.81%, respectively. At initial pH > 10.0, the EE/O values of AAF degradation by the O<sub>3</sub>/VUV was below 7.0 kWh m<sup>-3</sup> per order, showing the energy consumption was acceptable. The SPE/GC-MS analysis showed that toxic aniline was generated in the O<sub>3</sub>/VUV oxidation of AAF, but it was further degraded at a longer time. Compared to the ozonation, the O<sub>3</sub>/VUV had a much lower content of aniline at 180 min. The possible degradation pathways of AAF by the O<sub>3</sub>/VUV were proposed.
